website_summaries.verdict: A humorous approach to low-carb eating with easy-to-follow instructions.
pros: Helps you create low-carb versions of your favorite high-carb dishes
Includes a breakdown of many of the staple ingredients used throughout the book
Simple but delicious recipes are easy to follow
cons: Recipes are not accompanied by photos, not the most visually appealing

customer_reviews.title: Super high in protein. Perfect for keto meal prep
customer_reviews.text: I'm on an aggressive keto diet (<30g net carbs) for my cut. I use this book to meal prep 3 meals a day (breakfast, lunch, dinner, and 2 snacks) for 7 days. I've shed myself from 36% body fat to 14% body fat using this book, meal prepping, and daily exercise. The recipes are also super high in protein. I recommend eating avocados and using healthy oils to keep up the fat intake. I sub heavy cream+water for the recipes that call for milk. Perfect for me all around.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: My only complaint is that I bought both the 500 ...
customer_reviews.text: My only complaint is that I bought both the 500 recipe and 1001 recipe books. Most of the 500 recipes were in the 1001 book. Don't buy both.
customer_reviews.author: Darcy

customer_reviews.title: What a Find!
customer_reviews.text: On the low carb diet, and someone recommended this cookbook. Wow! What a find!! I'm an average cook at best, but find the recipes easy to follow. I did have to buy some ingredients that I don't normally have on hand, but that was fine with me. We've tried 4 recipes in the last 2 weeks, and each one of them have been a big hit. My hubby is a picky eater, and he can't believe they are this good. It's nice to be able to fix a different meal and it's good also!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looking forward to trying, but too many slow cooker recipes
customer_reviews.text: I have not tried any recipes yet, but they all look really good. However, personally, I would appreciated more "quick and easy" recipes. While looking through the book, I realized that there were way more slow cooker recipes than quick meals. I would have loved more of a balance. Many of the sides are cauliflower recipes as well. More variety with sides would be a great addition.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: LIMITED NUTRITIONAL INFORMATION
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited about this book and then sooooo disappointed! These dishes are VERY high calorie, high fat and give NO nutritional information except carb content! I have never seen a cookbook that advertises ANY kind of diet leave out so much information. Besides that, it's paperback, flimsy, no pictures and full of unfamiliar, highly processed and unhealthy ingredients. This is going back!
customer_reviews.author: wp72

customer_reviews.title: Lots of recipes!
customer_reviews.text: This book has a lot of recipes! Some of the items/ingredients are special order though, you will need to really look around to find a few of them. Organized really well by recipe type. Great choice to help you learn low carb cooking.
customer_reviews.author: kebuck

customer_reviews.title: The Number One Cookbook In My Kitchen!
customer_reviews.text: This is my go-to book for everything I want to cook. Good recipes easy to prepare and easy to adjust. This is a book that will do a lot to help you stay on a low carb diet. She has lots of explanations in the front also, which are very helpful. There are so many recipes here that it's hard to imagine that you wouldn't find some you like, if you are really on a low carb diet. The cookies have been a Godsend for my family to keep away the sugar cravings. I definitely would recommend this book if you are on a low-carb diet. It makes it so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Truth Seeker

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes, meets my needs very well
customer_reviews.text: Great recipes, meets my needs very well. I saw it in a book store, and decided to buy used. It was in Excellent condition.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kinney

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Was Looking For
customer_reviews.text: Low Carb can get boring if you don't shake things up with a new recipe once in a while. This book should keep me on track for a long time to come. I can't wait to get into the cheesecake recipes!
customer_reviews.author: Kathi Linz

customer_reviews.title: Mainly for the soups but some other good recipes in other sections
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this cook-book for years, both low carb and not. Mainly for the soups but some other good recipes in other sections. The baked good section has some recipes calling for vital wheat gluten and other odd ingredients that the author no longer stands behind, may want to skip those although a few tasted pretty good when I made them!
customer_reviews.author: Carley

customer_reviews.title: Lots of recipes
customer_reviews.text: The paperback cover was flimsy. When shipped the back cover was folded over creating a permanent crease. Would have returned it for a new one but it was a gift and I needed it that day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be Prepared to Shop
customer_reviews.text: Unless you live in a big city—or want to shop on Amazon for every meal—I would not recommend this book. Most recipes require special ingredients that are very difficult to find. Also, there are no pictures of any of the meals.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndie Shaffstall

customer_reviews.title: Like new condition, and arrived quickly
customer_reviews.text: Bought it used. Arrived quickly. Bought it for the bread recipes, not too pleased with those, but other recipes are great.
customer_reviews.author: ZaraH.

customer_reviews.title: Almost every recipe I've tried, I love- and I've made a lot of them!
customer_reviews.text: This book is NOT just for low-carbers. She uses a lot of artificial sweeteners so I just replace them with smaller amounts of real sugar, which is no problem. She uses LOTS of different spice combinations, with a wonderful variety in flavors and styles. I checked this book out from the library, kept it for 2 months, and bought my own copy because I was so impressed with everything I was making- and with 1001 recipes, I still have LOTS more to try! The recipes are pretty easy in general, and I've been able to come up with my own variations of recipes just by starting with what she has. This is a really stellar collection of recipes!
customer_reviews.author: Soleildream

customer_reviews.title: change of heart
customer_reviews.text: This is basically a great low carb cookbook. I have had it for a couple months and have made 4 things from it, all of which were very good....love the cheesecake recipes. Just know, before you buy it, that Dana has since decided that wheat gluten is NOT a good thing after all, for low carbers or anyone else. Whether or not you agree is up to you. I don't know how many exactly, but a good number of recipes in this book call for gluten as an ingredient. Just so you know....
customer_reviews.author: E. Toth

customer_reviews.title: The Ultimate Low-Carb Recipe Source!
customer_reviews.text: As a long time low-carber I am always looking for new recipes. This book is packed FULL of awesome recipes! Leave it to Dana Carpender to provide a gigantic source of low-carb recipes in ONE book! I've been a fan of her books for a very long time. There are a few repeats of recipes from some of her other recipe books but that's ok because I like them compiled all in ONE source. This is the ultimate low-carbers cookbook source!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Ring

customer_reviews.title: This book has Bread Machine Recipes!!!! That are lo-carb!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This book has recipes to use in your bread machine! That is amazing. Just got all of the ingredients in from Swanson Vitamins where you can order an amazing amount of them from Bob's Red Mill for cheaper that going to the grocery store!!! Delivered right to your house...looking forward to playing with these recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I Lost a Lot of Weight and Enjoyed the Experience
customer_reviews.text: I've lost about 170 lbs. on a low-carb diet in the last couple of years. I'm a whole new person. This collection of recipes is one of the reasons why. At first I thought about all the high-carb things I'd have to give up, but this book reminded me of all the delicious low-carb foods I can still enjoy. It gave me the courage to experiment with sauces and seasonings and even to appreciate seafood, which I used to think I didn't like.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Frederick

customer_reviews.title: A must for anyone following a low-carb diet plan!
customer_reviews.text: If you are into a low-carb or a high protein diet, this is a great cookbook to use. There are so many options and they don't require hard to find or impossible ingredients. There is seriously something there for meal, side, snack.....you name it. I have many of Dana Carpender's books and this one did not disappoint. Recipes are easy to make and delicious!
customer_reviews.author: Diane M. Barnett

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful taste, texture and flavor!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this book a very short time and have already tried a number of the recipes and find them to be all great! There are a couple of recipes I had to pass up because they have an ingredient I am not able to find locally, but there are enough other choices to make up for these. The taste, texture, flavor and ease of making these recipes is well worth it and my stomach has reduced down significantly by reducing the amount of carbs. Love this!
customer_reviews.author: Sweetpea

customer_reviews.title: Yet Another Recipe Book
customer_reviews.text: Yet another recipe book. We have thousands of them, and this is just another one. Is it useful? Yes, of course it is, but it's nothing special in the scheme of things.
customer_reviews.author: Tim H.

customer_reviews.title: Finally some Low Carb recipes that might keep you sticking with the program
customer_reviews.text: It's become difficult to eat low carb, never thought I'd get tired of bacon and eggs and meat. But we have. Really missing the fruits, too. This book contains many recipes for sauces and dressings and marinades, which are exactly what we were looking for. At least now the meat will have variety! The sauces we've tried are just great, and we really needed them. Pretty hard to stick with a low carb plan without them.
customer_reviews.author: lacey

customer_reviews.title: Great book for low carb
customer_reviews.text: This book has alot of awesome recipes, now I just need to try them. I recomend this book to anyone who is on low carb.
customer_reviews.author: Klb334

customer_reviews.title: Great Cook Book
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic cook book!!! It has some of the most delicious dishes that are quick and easy to make. There are dishes for everyone even picky eaters, in fact you don't even know you are eating healthy the food taste great!! The best part about it is you can find your favorite recipes made healthier.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly

customer_reviews.title: 1001 Low-Carb Recipes
customer_reviews.text: I was in love with Dana Carpender's book "500......." and was disappointed to find out most of those recipes are in the 1001 Recipe book. However, I love her recipes and make a lot of them often
customer_reviews.author: Janice VanDine

customer_reviews.title: I liked the book
customer_reviews.text: I own her other Low carb recipe book but this one has added recipes to it. The only part I find hard is finding all the ingredients. I just got the book so haven't had time to do a lot of the recipes yet. All the ones I have tried I really liked. Tasted good and low carb. I used her other book every day and will do the same with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Low Carb Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: This is a great selection of low carb recipes that proves once and for all that low-carb eating doesn't have to be boring. There is a terrific variety of dishes, and the author's breezy, humorous style makes reading it fun. Another strong point is the number of ethnic recipes. If I could only own one low-carb cookbook, this would be the one. Wish it was available spiral-bound.
customer_reviews.author: F. R. Wuensche

customer_reviews.title: WOW! BIG Cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: I am in the "process" of reading this and have implemented it already, but will REALLY utilize this cook book come January 2nd! Not gonna mess with the Holidays too much, but when I'm not eating HOLIDAY DINNERS, I'll be following this book!
customer_reviews.author: Dianna Coplen

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: no pictures, how am i supposed to know what it looks like
customer_reviews.author: naysbabe

customer_reviews.title: disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing because the only reason there are 1001 instead of 201 is that there are probably five VARIATIONS of each recipe.
customer_reviews.author: bk213

customer_reviews.title: Good Book
customer_reviews.text: I have used this book many times. Being on low carbs, it is difficult to find desserts, but this book has helped. The beginning of the book explains some of the "unusual" ingredients she uses in the various recipes. This helped me a lot because I had seen them in recipes before and did not know what the items contributed to the recipes. Now I know and I have purchased quite a few of them. I would suggest this book for anyone on a low carb lifestyle.
customer_reviews.author: Jaxlady

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this cookbook, but I was disappointed. The recipes have ingredients I have nervous heard of. Pros: Good Paperweight Cons: No pictures and boring
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for people 'new' to low carb cooking
customer_reviews.text: I was really trying to find something that would give me something 'new' to cook, but I didn't really find much that I wasn't already cooking. There is one recipe for a spectacular mousse that I've made repeatedly though!
customer_reviews.author: Donna Loux Dba Vintage

customer_reviews.title: I love this cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I love this cookbook. My daughter has one and I was going to borrow hers. She told me that she had gotten it used from Amazon so I ordered one so I could have my own copy. It arrived in great condition and I'm sure I'll get a lot of use from it.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria J. Seeders

customer_reviews.title: Issue with Recipes
customer_reviews.text: Lots of recipes to choose from; unfortunately I can't choose from many of the desserts recipes because nearly all of them use Splenda or Stevia. Great for low carb (I guess), terrible for low sugar.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Low Carb Recipes
customer_reviews.text: This is a great diabetic recipe book. Very low/no carb recipes. Carbs are a diabetic's nightmare. Will warn it is not low fat. The chocolate chip cookies are my favorite.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Recipes for every taste
customer_reviews.text: The book is well organized into foods, and usually has several recipes to choose from for a particular vegetable or meat. I miss not having pictures, but with 1001 recipes available, it's already pretty thick. It does require some special ingredients, much of which are available in a well-stocked grocery store or health food store, but some items have to be ordered on-line.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressed
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, I only bookmarked 2 recipes in this book. I would have liked to see more appetizers and snacks. Chips? Sausage balls? What about hamburger buns? For me, this book wasn't extremely accessible. For example, I tend to make crustless desserts in cupcake tins, but all the recipes seem to be high maintenance and time consuming, which tends to cause diet burnout.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Coghlan

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had that much experience with low carb and was dreading the whole eat bacon with cheese on top mindset. I knew I needed a good cookbook to help me with basic recipes but that were healthy AND low card. This cookbook helps me with that and I already have some solid favorites that I enjoy on a weekly basis.
customer_reviews.author: J Black

customer_reviews.title: Getting a lot of use!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first book from Dana Carpender I bought, so I can't compare it to her other work. But since it includes so many recipes, I'm using it a ton! It's got a great range of recipes, and I'm getting a lot out of it. Some recipes use ingredients that are hard for me to get, but since there are so many options I just choose those that I can find the ingredients for at my grocery store. Excellent stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Benny S

customer_reviews.title: Goodwill
customer_reviews.text: Well have not even opened it up but pulled it out of the shipping bag and well if I would have went to the goodwill I could have saved me some money ( I can not get the photo to load but it has a 2.99 goodwill sticker on it)
customer_reviews.author: daniel brantley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Low Carb Eater
customer_reviews.text: There are lots of recipes in this book that are not the usual that you find online and yet, don't have strange ingredients. This is my go-to book. (I lost 130 pounds in 12 months, all by low carb diet so a good cookbook was vital!)
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Johnston

customer_reviews.title: 4 Words: Low-Carb White Russian
customer_reviews.text: This book had me from the very beginning. It's laid out in a manner that is easy to read and understand.Some recipes seem kind of..well..dumb (Such as; Low carb sweet tea. Req: Water, tea bags, artificial sweetener). but others are wonderful and make you really want to make them (See; everything under Poultry, Pork, beef, fish, sides, etc..)
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: no photos...
customer_reviews.text: 1000 recipes not a single photo... Maybe not as important for everyone, but I believe a cooking book doesn't have any appeal if there is no photos of the subject...
customer_reviews.author: V. Campos

customer_reviews.title: Delicious low carb meals
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this cookbook! I am on a low-carb, and I was getting so tired of eating baked chicken. I bought this cookbook because I needed some new low-carb dishes. There are tons of delicious low-carb meals in this book. I'm happy I found this cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: Pumpkin

customer_reviews.title: Just a home cook that needs something quick and EASY. Most of these recipes have way too many ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't know too many people who cook this way. I am not a chef. Just a home cook that needs something quick and EASY. Most of these recipes have way too many ingredients and are too complicated. Some are very good and easy.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Adams

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic cookbook
customer_reviews.text: This book is chockful of wonderful low carb recipes. I've already recommended it to several people. I've tried several of the recipes, and they are really good. I collect cookbooks, and this one is by far the best I have in my collection of over 200.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Great Book to Start with Low-Carb
customer_reviews.text: Great Recipes, Yes I do tweek some of the recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Viv

customer_reviews.title: She states in her opening to book that if you ...
customer_reviews.text: She states in her opening to book that if you also need to lose weight, you need to also count calories but not one recipe gives a calorie count. Book is currently in my donate box.
customer_reviews.author: Diane R Keller

customer_reviews.title: 1001 low-carb recipes
customer_reviews.text: Found tons of recipes that are helping me stay on track. Great cook book. Easy recipes that taste really wonderful
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tempting recipes
customer_reviews.text: I haven't been on the Atkins diet for long but am having great results. This book has given me many ideas and tips. Most of the recipes are for later stages of the diet, so I haven't tried many yet. They look very good and easy. I especially like the fact that they use kitchen appliances like the crock pot and bread maker to keep things simple.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Wildermuth

customer_reviews.title: Great cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: simple easy to follow directions. I ordered it for my husband as his doctor just told him he should consider a low carb diet. He likes the cookbook and has already made a few items out of it. The directions are well written. Many of the recipes are simple easy to follow with standard stuff available in most well stocked kitchens.
customer_reviews.author: Jodie

customer_reviews.title: Yum
customer_reviews.text: Low carb recipes can get to be boring and blah, this cook book has some great flavor packing items that make life at the kitchen table nice and enjoyable! Over 500 pages of awesome treats, lunches, dinners, etc. My kids and husband all enjoy too :)
customer_reviews.author: Hersom

customer_reviews.title: good reference book
customer_reviews.text: good reference book. Not all recipes are carbs under 10 grams, must read all carb counts in recipes to make sure they are in the range you are looking for.
customer_reviews.author: nmart

customer_reviews.title: Page missing
customer_reviews.text: I have used this book a few times and just this morning I turned a page and there was a page ripped out of the book (pg 311 and 312). Not happy!!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Carnes

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first book of Dana Carpender so obviously I don't have the problem of repeated recipes. This recipe book is a must have for anyone starting or needing more ideas on their low-carb lifestyle! Every recipe we've tried (and it's many) has been absolutely delicious! Only Thing I'm not so big on is that she sometimes goes a little bit too low fat on some recipes, why use half-half cream and not heavy whipping cream? All in all a GREAT cook book.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. M

customer_reviews.title: Returned it!
customer_reviews.text: No pictures and uses a lot of ingredients that are hard to find. Why can't they use normal items found in real food.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Marks

customer_reviews.title: Good variety and way better than 2 other cookbooks I ...
customer_reviews.text: Good variety and way better than 2 other cookbooks I just purchased. LOTS of recipes for everything and the recipes look tasty.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: My everyday go-to
customer_reviews.text: I know everybody is on the low carb kick these days, but I have always had to watch what I eat my entire life. As I was just running low on ideas and recipes that my entire family would enjoy, I went searching for a cookbook to help me. I found it! Very easy to follow, and it definitely has given me a baseline for creating some of my own recipes as well.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: Low carb cookbook
customer_reviews.text: This book have tons of recipes for low carb and it's awesome.. I would recommend anyone to use it whoever is on low carb diet.
customer_reviews.author: tigerlady53

customer_reviews.title: Even includes recipes for those who enjoy adult beverages
customer_reviews.text: The low-carb dieter can't go wrong with this book. Even includes recipes for those who enjoy adult beverages.
customer_reviews.author: Rita S. Hebert

customer_reviews.title: 1001 Low-Carb Recipes
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for this book. I was recently diagnosed with Diabetes and this cookbook helped me change my diet and help me lose weight. It helps you to learn how to cut carbs and calories. But, The food tastes good too!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn M. Swartz

customer_reviews.title: Great collection for Atkins type low carb dieters
customer_reviews.text: Somebody said these recipes aren't original but are a compilation of the low carb recipes that work best. So far, this has been my experience. If the experience holds up, I'm happy and recommend the collection unreservedly.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M. Ross, Ph.D.

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!  Thanks!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a lot of cook books that say they are "Easy Lo Carb". This one truly is. It's has an index at the end that makes it much easier to browse as there are too many recipes to conveniently browse though.
customer_reviews.author: CoryC

customer_reviews.title: I Really loved this Cook Book for Carb Cutters!  Easy recipies!
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful cook book! So full of great Low Carb ideas to perk up your dining experiences as you get healthier. Very simple and to the point recipes! Easy for those of us that aren't as talented in the kitchen as others. LOL
customer_reviews.author: Akasha R. Babos

customer_reviews.title: Good information as well as good recipes
customer_reviews.text: Many good recipes, size of book and print makes much easier to read. Really like the information at the front, explanation of many ingredients, some of which are a bit unusual - that's a plus, something new to try is always fun.
customer_reviews.author: cattoes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and Comprehensive Library of Great Low-Carb Recipes
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing list of low-carb recipes from 2g of carbs to 40g of carbs. It is packed full of great recipes -- I'll never get around t all of them but I'm gonna try. Offered at a very reasonable prices and shipped very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Campbell

customer_reviews.title: 1001 Low-Carb Recipes
customer_reviews.text: I haven't tried most of the recipes, but I have marked many of them to try soon. The dishes I have made using the recipes from this cookbook have been delicious. Most of the ingredients are readily available, although there are several I have not found in main stream grocery stores. The author has provided a section with lots of helpful hints, substitutions and where to find the not-so-common ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Gale B

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes
customer_reviews.text: This book is full of great recipes. Definitely worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Roney

customer_reviews.title: This is HANDS DOWN the best low carb cook book I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: This is HANDS DOWN the best low carb cook book I have ever had. Huge variety - excellent ideas I hadn't thought of. Absolutely the best. I have already given it as a gift a few times.
customer_reviews.author: katherine rogers

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: Great recipies a lot of sauces and gravies bread recipies love it
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: I have to say this cookbook is awesome. I had not purchased any of Dana's earlier cookbooks. So for me this has it all. I was getting bored with my own limited colletion of recipies.I needed the boost of 1001 new ideas, Wow! I feel like I can make these items too ~Nothing to difficult or intimidating here. These recipies sound great,and taste great,too.They are dishes I want to try and/or enjoyed before becoming low-carb and they are de-carbed for me! Recommended,and worth the price, definately!
customer_reviews.author: T. A. Mora

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy cooking again
customer_reviews.text: After working all day I had almost given up on cooking meals except on week-end. The recipes in this book are easy and most are quick. I am cooking again and loving it, with an added bonus of loosing weight.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn

customer_reviews.title: It's a pretty good book
customer_reviews.text: It's a pretty good book, they are some ingredients in it that are hard to find but other than that pretty awesome.
customer_reviews.author: SF50

customer_reviews.title: A must have !
customer_reviews.text: A must have for anyone that is looking for good low carb recipes. I really have enjoyed this cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: Raysluck

customer_reviews.title: Love this easy to use cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: This book has some very easy, great low carb recipes. I use it all the time. Anyone can make these recipes that are simple and tasty. The only thing I would suggest is not using the Splenda and replace it with Stevia.
customer_reviews.author: yankeelady49

customer_reviews.title: ... some recipes from this book and my husband has loved every plate
customer_reviews.text: I started to cook 2 weeks ago some recipes from this book and my husband has loved every plate, I'm glad for bought the book :)
customer_reviews.author: Angélica contreras

customer_reviews.title: 1001 Low Carb Recipes
customer_reviews.text: Dana Carpenter has taken everyday recipes and made them LOW CARB the best part.....they all taste great. We were skeptical but so far, every recipe I have made for my family we have loved... I highly recommend this book so much that I have had my friends buy it also..
customer_reviews.author: NoLongerNurse

customer_reviews.title: Great low carb recipes!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great collection of low carb recipes. Gives tons of options to get into a healthy lifestyle. I use recipes from this book several times a week from breakfast items, soups, desserts, entrees and deserts.
customer_reviews.author: JFREI

customer_reviews.title: Detailed and well written!
customer_reviews.text: This is a book that has given me the chance to try several low-carb recipes and begin to lead a healthier life. The recipes are well written, easy to understand and do not require all expensive ingredients. I really enjoy the recipes in this book!
customer_reviews.author: Angelia Young

customer_reviews.title: Healthier eating!
customer_reviews.text: I have added this to my cookbook collection. I enjoy reading the recipes, especially the picture presentations. I love to cook!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Foley

customer_reviews.title: 1001 low carb recipes
customer_reviews.text: There is a lot of interesting recipes in this book. I would have given it 5 stars if it had more "good old country cooking" type of recipes in it. It is still well worth the money. I showed it to my niece and she is ordering one. :o) I hope everyone has a great day. :o)
customer_reviews.author: Leon

customer_reviews.title: Eh.......
customer_reviews.text: Eh its okay. No pictures which really really sucks. I like to see what something looks like so I know if it even looks appealing. Thought about sending it back. I don't know...
customer_reviews.author: Randi

customer_reviews.title: A GREAT RESOURCE!
customer_reviews.text: A definite MUST for anyone following a low-carb eating plan. I have found numerous ideas and techniques that have made my life so much easier. A lot of research has gone into this book. It is easy to read, the recipes are easy to fix and very tasty...at least the ones I have sampled. The only suggestion I have for future books is that a calorie count would be helpful. I believe this is the best, most helpful and most informative cookbook I have found so far. I was concerned that it might be hard to manage...it is a large book, but I found that it lays flat when opened...another plus!
customer_reviews.author: Breezy

customer_reviews.title: Helps my diabetic husband
customer_reviews.text: My new husband is diabetic. He has greatly decreased the amount of insulin use by better monitoring of his carb intake.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine L Flowers

customer_reviews.title: variety
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy this cookbook it has a lot of stuff in it that you wouldn't even think you could put together and it taste good.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina A Roland

customer_reviews.title: Lots of good low carb recipes
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I wanted: variety in low carb cooking. There are no pictures; but the book makes up for that with the sheer number of recipes it offers.
customer_reviews.author: sower

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A gift as with the diabetes. Helps keep the carbs down and a1c.
customer_reviews.author: David M Santo

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes.
customer_reviews.text: This book is great and filled with many low cal low carb recipes. Would suggest this one for any one trying to change to a healthier lifestyle.
customer_reviews.author: D. Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Good information
customer_reviews.text: This is a good cook book for low carbs. I usually like pictures which this hasn't but the recipes are good and plenty.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: cook book
customer_reviews.text: Easy to follow, but not highly imaginable. Good guide for "every day, throw something on the table when you get home from work, dead tired" guide.
customer_reviews.author: anne

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Lots of yummy recipes for all meals. From simple to more complex recipes
customer_reviews.author: peludo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just great, as all Dana's books are! The Queen of low carb lifestyle.
customer_reviews.author: Nanny

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not user friendly. Has a lot of ingredients that are not common, which means they are a little pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Colein

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes!  Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Ms. Carpender is a treasure! Excellent recipes, all together on one book, at a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Reader in Palo Alto

customer_reviews.title: 1001 Low-Carb Recipes
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the book. I have used Dana Carpender's cookbooks before and enjoy her blog. This cookbook is excellent and practical which is a great help when cooking low-carb meals.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but stale
customer_reviews.text: I'm generally a fan of Dana Carpender's recipes and have used a lot of her low-carb recipes earlier. I decided to try this "new" recipe book only to find out it's really not new. That being said, it really depends how many of her books/recipes you have already tried. If this is your first, it's a great buy. If you have bought other books before, pass on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Olivera

customer_reviews.title: very useful recipes
customer_reviews.text: Have already made several recipes from this book. Very practical recipes that appeal to entire family not just the person trying to stay low carb. Ingredients typically ones most cooks have in their pantry.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha Hall

customer_reviews.title: Great LoCarb cookbook
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent lo carb book. There are many good recipes with healthy ingredients and prepared in a easy to understand and follow outline.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Mast

customer_reviews.title: This Book make Low Carb the Answer
customer_reviews.text: Wow, so many options and so many ideas. I now see and know that low-carb can be a lifstyle that I can live with. This book gives you everything you need to stay in the lifestyle and NEVER get bored. I love this book and have used many of the ideas and recipies. Thank you Dana Carpenter. You have given us a huge gift in this book.
customer_reviews.author: KayBMom

product_meta.title: 1,001 Low-Carb Recipes: Hundreds of Delicious Recipes from Dinner to Dessert That Let You Live Your Low-Carb Lifestyle and Never Look Back
